item.title: Research
item.description: Cohort effects in literary fiction Max Planck has said, pessimistically, that science advances one funeral at a time. Can we say the same about literary fiction? Do new genres of fiction appear as a result of demographic turnover, or are they driven by the individual change of preferences during the authors’ lifespans? In this project, Bret Beheim and I use large book corpora and stochastic simulations to understand the role of demography in literature.
